conclusion: Analyze forces on blocks A and B using friction coefficients to find mass ratio.
Image shows blocks A and B on a horizontal surface; B is pushed horizontally and in contact with A.
Identify forces on block A: kinetic friction \(f_{A} = \mu_2 m_A g\).
Identify forces on block B: kinetic friction \(f_{B} = \mu_1 m_B g\).
Block A is about to slip, so applied force equals kinetic friction on A: \(F = \mu_2 m_A g\).
Block B is about to slide down, so applied force equals kinetic friction on B: \(F = \mu_1 m_B g\).
Equate expressions for \(F\): \(\mu_2 m_A g = \mu_1 m_B g\).
